summary: This bill, HR 945, proposes awarding a Congressional Gold Medal to the Freedom Riders for their crucial contribution to the Civil Rights Movement. It details the history of the Freedom Rides, focusing on their courageous efforts to desegregate interstate travel, the violence they faced, and the eventual impact on federal law and the integration of transit systems. The bill outlines the steps for medal presentation, design, and display at the Smithsonian Institution, including the production and sale of bronze duplicates.
